get_compile_data

Md Aminul Islam Prodhan

Oct-07-2024

Source: vignettes/Compile_Data_calculation_documentation.Rmd
Compile_Data_calculation_documentation.Rmd

Function: get_compile_data

Overview

get_compile_data is a versatile function designed to filter out toxicokinetic (TK) and recovery animals from a study database. The function takes various inputs to specify the study ID and database path, and it includes options for handling both SQLite and .xpt file formats, particularly when dealing with data generated by the SENDsanitizer package. The primary aim is to clean and compile study data, ensuring that the results are focused on the target set of animals.

Function Parameters

  • studyid (Mandatory, Character):
    The study ID number, which uniquely identifies the study within the database.

  • path_db (Mandatory, Character):
    The path to the database file. This could be a path to an SQLite database or a directory containing .xpt files.

  • fake_study (Optional, Boolean):
    Indicates if the study data has been generated using the SENDsanitizer package. Defaults to FALSE.

  • use_xpt_file (Optional, Boolean):
    Specifies whether to use .xpt file format when dealing with data generated by the SENDsanitizer package. Defaults to FALSE.

Return Value

The function returns a cleaned and compiled data frame with filtered study data, ready for further analysis.

Key Features

  1. Data Fetching: Establishes a connection to the database (or reads .xpt files) and retrieves necessary domain data such as dm (Demographics) and ts (Trial Summary).
  2. Data Processing: Performs data transformations, including renaming columns, updating values, and selecting relevant columns.
  3. Filtering Logic:
    • Converts “Control” groups to “vehicle” and retains only animals in the “vehicle” or “HD” (high-dose) groups.
    • Removes recovery animals using the ds (Disposition) domain.
    • Excludes toxicokinetic (TK) animals for rat studies by analyzing the pp (Pharmacokinetics) and pooldef domains.
  4. Species Detection and Handling: Extracts species information from the ts domain to customize the filtering logic for different species.

Example Usage

#```{r} # Example call to get_compile_data # Note: Replace ‘path/to/database.db’ with the actual path to your database #get_compile_data(studyid = ‘1234123’, path_db = ‘path/to/database.db’)
